Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Magistrate Judge Justo Arenas as to Angel A. Rodriguez-Ortiz. Case was called for a Change of Plea Hearing, but was not held. AUSA Jose Capo and defense counsel Mariangela Tirado were present. The parties were talking off-the-record in the Spanish language as to the plea agreement and defendant does not wish to sign the plea agreement as redacted. Defense counsel presented the reasons why defendant does not wish to sign the plea agreement as tendered or the statement of facts (the last page) as redacted for certain fears that he has which are the results of information he receives in prison. The change of plea motion is withdrawn. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting. Defense counsel requested transcript of this hearing. The Court granted the request. ORDER re 1461 Motion to Continue as to Jose Cintron-Echautegui (14). DENIED. That Civil trial began on 5/12/2008. ORDER re 1489 MOTION in Compliance to order to show cause filed by Jose Cintron- Echautegui. Counsel may not excuse improper conduct with "after the facts events". Counsel knew, at least since 5/16/2008 he was to be on trial by 5/20/2008, date in which sentence was scheduled to take place at 3:00 p.m. In submitting an untimely request for continuance, states he had been summoned by the Mgistrate-Judge for 3:00 PM. Something not true or correct. Fact that events in the civil trial concluded later on, could have been anticipated by counsel. Burden of dealing with events transpiring on said date were transferred to the Court and Court personnel and U.S. Marshals who had to engage in overtime. Counsel's lack of diligence, for second time in the same case, warrants that a sanction in the amount of $200 be imposed. Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 5/28/2008.(wm) (Entered: 05/28/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Mag. Judge Justo Arenas: Change of Plea Hearing as to Jose A. Torres-Canales held on 9/4/2008. AUSA Jose Capo and defense counsel Juan Pedrosa were present. Defendant is present in court and under custody. Consent was approved, filed and made part of the record. The defendant is found competent to plea. The Magistrate Judge will recommend to the Court that the Plea of Guilty be accepted as to Count One (1) of the Indictment. The defendant is to remain under custody. A report and recommendation will be issued. The Court orders the preparation of a presentence report. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Jose Capo, for defendant, Miriam Ramos-Grateroles and PO, Guillermo Arbona. Defendant is present in Court and is (U/C).Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Luis A. Reyes-Rodriguez held on 10/14/2010. Testimony on behalf of the Government, by Irving Ofray-Vazquez-FBI, Agent and PO, Guillermo Arbona, is heard. Cross examination by defense counsel is held. Arguments by counsel are heard. The Court after hearing arguments of counsel makes ruling for the record and finds probable cause as follows: as to the first motion filed by the PO, (docket #2032) the Court finds probable cause as to violations #1,#2 and #3. As to violation #4, which has to do with employment, the Court doesn't find probable cause. As to the second motion filed by PO, (docket #2047), the Court finds probable cause. This matter shall be referred to Judge Delgado for full revocation hearing. Govt's exh. 1, admitted. Deft's exh. A, admitted. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Rafael Arismendi-Padilla held on 11/14/2013. AUSA Michael Bagge and AFPD Victor Gonzalez were present. The parties met at side bar. Testimony of PO Katherine Wohlauer was heard on behalf of the Government. The Government understands that defendant has some mental issues and that some sort of treatment be provided to avoid any harm to him or others. Defense counsel agreed that defendant be afforded treatment. However, he is in disagreement that defendant has violated any of his conditions. After hearing the testimony and the parties, the Court took the matter under advisement. Defendant will be released directly from the Court and placed under the custody of his father, Mr. Rafael Arismendi-Romero, who will hospitalize defendant today in Pavia Hospital in Hato Rey. Once released or discharged from the hospital, Mr. Arismendi-Romero will notify the probation officer. Standard release conditions, be left on his own recognizance with third party custodian of father, in-patient psychiatric evaluation and treatment, drug testing and treatment, if needed, are all imposed. A Further Preliminary Hearing will be set. (PO Katherine Wohlauer) (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 03:24. Hearing ended at 04:37. Interpreter Marie Hernandez. (br) (Entered: 11/15/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Jose A. Torres-Canales (20) held on 10/1/2014. Present: AUSA Mariana Bauza and AFPD Thomas Trebilcock. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Orlando Rullan also present. Government informs that the witnesses are ready to testify, clarifies that the alleged victim of the Law 54 incident, will be testifying on behalf of the defendant. A proffer of the victim's statement is given to the Court. Sidebar Conference held and case will be recalled. Court notes that parties listened to audio recordings and jointly request that the hearing be continued and held after the defendant's state trial (set for 11/6/2014) has concluded. Court grants the request. The US Marshals are ordered to transfer the defendant to the custody of the state authorities so he can attend the state trial. A detainer to be lodged. As soon as the state proceedings have concluded, he's to be returned immediately to federal custody and revocation proceedings will then be held. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 2:30 p.m. Hearing held at 2:40 p.m. Hearing ended at 3:05 p.m. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (sr) (Entered: 10/06/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Show Cause Hearing as to Rafael Arismendi-Padilla (42) held on 5/6/2015. Present were AUSA Julia Meconiates, AFPD Vivianne Marrero, AFPD Vivian Torralbas. Defendant was present and under conditions of supervised release. AFPD Marrero addressed the Court stating that defendant admitted the first two violations (dkt. 2542 and first allegation of dkt. 2527) and denied the last one (second allegation of dkt. 2527). AUSA Meconiates argued for defendant's detention. Sidebar held. After hearing both parties, the Court found probable cause as to the allegations defendant admitted and referred the matter to Chief Judge Delgado for the full hearing. The Court also modified his supervised release conditions, after speaking with the presider, so that defendant can enter an inpatient substance abuse program on Friday, two days from  today, through Probation. Defendant is to be home incarcerated with EM when he will enter said program, plus he must complied with being at home all the time, and mental health is also to be included. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Jose A. Torres-Canales (20) held on 7/14/2015. Present: AUSA Mariana Bauza and defense counsel Thomas Trebilcock. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Gabriel Feliciano also present. Court notes that the case has been pending for awhile due to the trial that was still pending at state level. Defense counsel informs his client went to bench trial on all charges and was acquitted. Government informs that subpoenas were issued, yet her two witnesses have failed to appear in court. Court orders them to show cause and arrest warrants to be issued and they are to be brought before the Court upon arrest. Government moves that defendant be revoked for use of controlled substances. Defense will not contest that allegation. SRT is revoked. IMPR: Time served. SRT of 60 months. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 10:00 a.m. Hearing held at 10:15 a.m. Hearing ended at 10:45 a.m. Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (sr) (Entered: 07/14/2015)

Minute Order. for proceedings held beforeChief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: re 2452 Informative Motion Notifying Violations of Supervision Conditions as to Rafael Arismendi-Padilla (42); re 2596 Supplemental Motion as to Rafael Arismendi-Padilla (42), Noted. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Rafael Arismendi- Padilla (42) held on 8/26/2015. Present were: AUSA Alberto Lopez, AFPD Hector Ramos and USPO Nelson Mendoza. Defendant present O/B and assisted by the court interpreter. Defense counsel advised that will not contest the allegations of motion filed by U.S. Probation Officer. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment were heard on behalf of defendant. Governments position was heard. Defendants allocution was heard. After having heard the parties, the Court finds that the defendant violated the conditions of supervised release. Therefore, the supervised release term previously imposed is hereby revoked. IMPR: Twenty-Four (24) Months; SRT: Twenty-Four (24) Months. Defendant was advised his right to appeal. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) (Court Interpreter Moises Hernandez.) Hearing set for 10:30. Hearing held at 10:42. Hearing ended at 11:03. (amr) (Entered: 08/28/2015)

Miuinute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Re- sentencing (revocation proceedings) as to Alexander Rodriguez-Melendez (19) held on 2/2/2017, pursuant to the USCA's Opinion issued at ECF No. 2667. Present: AUSA Seth Erbe and AFPD Joannie Plaza. Defendant present, under custody and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Carlina Cortes also present. Court clarified that the information considered by the Court at the original revocation proceedings held on 10/8/2014, was provided by the US Probation Officer. Statements in support of mitigation heard on behalf of the defense. Counsel for defendant argued that the defendant only had one positive on 12/20/2013 and submitted Exhibits A-C for purposes of today's hearing. Argued that the defendant's juvenile adjudication should not be considered towards his criminal history, requested a sentence of not more than 21 months. Court will consider a criminal history category of III, factual findings are on the record. Defendant's allocution heard. IMPR: 24 months. No further SRT imposed, defendant is to serve SRT of 5 years in CR. 14-094 (CCC). Defendant informed through counsel that he will not appeal the sentence. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 3:30 p.m. Hearing held at 5:07 p.m. Hearing ended at 6:45 p.m. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (sr) (Entered: 02/09/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:Case called for Hearing on Revocation of Supervised Release as to Hector Garcia-Cartagena (24) held on February 20, 2018. Present were AUSA Kelly Zenon-Matos, and AFPD Edwin A. Mora-Rolland. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S. Marshals, and was assisted by certified interpreter. The defendant waived the hearing, and accepted the allegations as stated at the motions filed by the U.S. Probation Office. Counsel for the defendant proceeded to provide relevant mitigating circumstances to be considered by the Court. The defense presented legal arguments concerning the grade of violations, and Articles 401, and 406 of the Local Law, and requested a finding of a Grade B violation be determined and be sentenced to a term of 18 to 24 months of imprisonment to be served concurrently to the terms imposed at local level. Defendant's allocution heard. The United States stated that the guidelines to be applied in this case should be a Type B violation, and requested that the defendant be sentenced to 3 years to be served consecutively with the terms imposed at local level. The Court after having heard the arguments presented by the defense related to the United States' burden to present for today's hearing translations of the charging document, and the judgment issued at local level, continued the proceedings. The Court instructed Norman J. Rosario, U.S. Probation Officer to get translations of the documents in controversy from the local court within 30 days. Once translations are  filed, the defense shall place its position for the record, and then, the United States shall reply. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.)Hearing set for 04:30.Hearing held at 04:56.Hearing ended at 05:25. Interpreter Annie Flores. USPO Norman Rosario. (om) (Entered: 02/22/2018)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before U.S. District Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Hector Garcia-Cartagena (24) held on 6/11/2018. Present: AUSA Kelly Zenon and AFPD Edwin Mora. Defendant present, under custody and did not require the use of the Court Interpreter. USPO Nelson Rosario also present. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Argued that the violations incurred are a Grade B Violation  and requested that the term to be imposed be concurrent with the state sentence. Defendant's allocution heard. Arguments in opposition heard on behalf of the Government and argued that it is a Grade A violation and that the victim is available to testify, should defendant contest the violation. After hearing the parties, the SRT was revoked and an imprisonment term of 36 months was imposed to be served consecutively to the sentence imposed in the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico in GSC2017G0120-0121 & GLE2017G0191-0192. SRT of 72 months. Counsel for defendant preserved his objections on the record as to the term of imprisonment imposed by the Court. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.) Hearing set for 1:30 p.m. Hearing held at 2:15 p.m. Hearing ended at 3:00 p.m. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. Government's Interpreter Tom Kavelin also present. (sr) (Entered: 06/19/2018)

JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Hector Garcia-Cartagena (24). Delgado-Colon on 6/11/2018.(sr) (Entered: 06/19/2018)

ORDER regarding 2891 Informative Motion as to Jose A. Torres-Canales (20). Noted. Taking into account that there is no objection from the defense, the request to continue to the preliminary revocation hearing is granted. The preliminary revocation hearing is reset for May 21, 2020 at 10:00 am via Jabber. To avoid unnecessary delays, at least one hour before the hearing the government shall make available to the defense Jencks / FRCr.P 26.2 material. Because the hearing will be conducted remotely in a virtual courtroom, the United States shall be responsible for making the pertinent arrangements to have the witnesses appear via Jabber (as well as the usual arrangements for an interpreter should the witnesses not be fluent in English). Proper instructions for counsel to log in will be provided in advance of the hearing by separate email. Any objections to the hearing being conducted via Jabber must be filed at least one week prior to the hearing. With respect to the notice to use hearsay statement, the defense shall respond by April 22, 2020. Signed by US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez on 4/13/2020. Gjjr) (Entered: 04/13/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Jose A. Torres-Canales (20) held on 5/29/2020 through VTC. AUSA Corinne Cordero, AUSA Alberto Lopez and AFPD Jessica Earl were present through VTC. Defendant was under custody, present through VTC and assisted by the certified court interpreter. Defendant consented to proceed with the  hearing through VTC. The government called USPO Nelson Mendoza to the witness stand and sworn testimony was heard through VTC. Direct and cross examination was conducted. The government called PRPD Agent Angel L. Rosario Velez to the witness stand and sworn testimony was heard through VTC. Direct and cross examination was conducted. The parties requested a further preliminary revocation hearing in order to present more witnesses and bail arguments. The Court granted their request and set a Further Preliminary Revocation Hearing for 6/1/2020 at 1:00 PM through MEL's VTC Bridge before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. Court Reporter Amy Walker was present through VTC. Hearing set for 09:00. Hearing held at 09:16. Hearing ended at 04:08. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith, Felix Toledo and Carlos Ravelo were present through VTC. Government's interpreter Thomas Kavelin was present through VTC. (jr) Modified on 6/1/2020 to edit docket text as per CDC's request (mcm). (Entered: 05/29/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Jose A. Torres-Canales (20) held on 6/1/2020 through VTC. AUSA Corinne Cordero, AUSA Alberto Lopez and AFPD Jessica Earl were present through VTC. Defendant was under custody, present through VTC and assisted by the certified court interpreter. Defendant consented to proceed with the hearing through VTC. Government statements in support of probable cause were heard in regards to the murder allegation. Statements on behalf of the defendant were heard. After having heard the parties, the Court found probable cause as to the murder allegation. The government requested the dismissal without prejudice of the kidnapping and sexual assault allegations. The government's request was granted by the Court, therefore, the kidnapping and sexual assault allegations were dismissed without prejudice. Defense counsel argued for conditions of release. The government moved for detention. The Court ordered the defendant detained pending final revocation on the basis of danger to the community. The case is referred to the attention of Judge Aida M. Delgado Colon for the scheduling of a final revocation hearing. Court Reporter Joe Reynosa was present through VTC. Hearing set for 01:00. Hearing held at 01:03. Hearing ended at 01:49. Interpreter Carlos Ravelo was present through VTC. (jr) (Entered: 06/01/2020)

JUDGMENT of USCA as to Jose Rivera-Moreno (1) re 2918 Notice of Appeal - Final Judgment; Appellant Jose Rivera-Moreno is presently in default for failure to file a brief. The court previously issued a notice of default to appellant on December 10, 2020, which warned appellant that failure to file a brief would result in this appeal's dismissal for lack of diligent prosecution. The December 10, 2020 notice of default extended appellant's deadline to file a brief until December 24, 2020. Appellant has failed to comply and has not requested an extension of time to do so. Accordingly, it is ordered that the above-captioned appeal be DISMISSED. (mcm) (Entered: 02/01/2021)
